dct:title: Florida Superfund Waste Cleanup Sites
dct:creator: Florida Department of Environmental Protection and Division of Waste Management
dct:license: Because a variety of sources and methods were used to derive information for this data, the quality of the locations may vary accordingly. The data is undergoing review to improve accuracy. This data is intended to be used for general locational representation and should not be considered appropriate for legal and/or cadastral purposes.
dct:description: Point feature class of the superfund sites in Florida from the National Priority List (NPL).
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites/{download,etl} && cd /data/fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  wget -O download/fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites.json 'https://ca.dep.state.fl.us/arcgis/rest/services/OpenData/CLEANUP_SP/MapServer/1/query?where=1%3D1&outFields=*&outSR=4326&f=json'

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites.json

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites.json -nlt point -nln fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites',
  'geom_local',2236,'point',2
);
UPDATE fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(geom,2236)));
CREATE INDEX fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites_geom_local_idx
  ON fl_superfund_waste_cleanup_sites
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"
dcat:contactPoint: University of Miami Libraries, Frost Institute for Data Science and Computing
gdsc:label: name
